artist: Artist: Ōta Masamitsu; Carver: Nagai Otokichi; Printer: Kitajima Hidematsu
inscription:
on the attached paper:
Review of the print by Wakiya Mitsunobu
Carver:Nagai Otokichi
Printer:Kitajima Hidematsu
Producer:Miyake Yo_zo_
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Figures on the Stage in the Shōwa Period (Shōwa butai sugata 昭和舞台姿)
text: Actor Nakamura Utaemon VI (1917-2001) as shirabyōshi dancer in the play "Dōjōji." Shirabyōshi dancers performed in male dress at celebrations. She eventually becomes angry, pursues a Buddhist priest to his temple and will wreak revenge at the time of a bell ceremony, transformed into a hideous serpent.
title: No. 4, Actor Nakamura Utaemon VI in the play "Dōjōji"
